resources.string: Are you sure you would like to go back?

Welcome to this quick guide. This will help get you started and fill you in on what you need to know. First, you can connect to one of the public canvases by going to Connect and entering \'SMALL\', \'MEDIUM\', or \'LARGE\', each one is a different size. Once connected you will automatically start to gain pixels that you can use to draw onto the canvas.

It\'s worth mentioning that you get a certain amount of pixels over time from each canvas you have connected to. You will get pixels even if you aren\'t online, up to a maximum amount. It\'s limited so that no one person has too much control over a canvas. You can easily export and share pixel art that you see. Just use this icon and select what you want.

The canvas is interactive so as you draw, everyone can see what you\'re doing. Finally each pixel keeps a history of edits. Now onto tools… There are a few basic tools. The first lets you change the canvas background to different colors.
The next one allows you to turn on and off canvas grid lines. When you are far from the canvas, grid lines are always toggled off.
This shows you an overview of the canvas.
Use this to show and hide the toolbox. If your camera punch-out is here, simply click right next to the punch-out.
Finally this shows and hides your recently used colors. And that\'s all there is to getting started.

The default color palette is the Recent Color palette. It is composed of all colors that you have drawn with recently. To add a new color palette tap on \"Recent Color\" in the draw panel. Then tap the + button and enter a name for your new palette. The new palette will be added to your list of palettes. Select the new palette by tapping on it in the list. As you use the color picker to select colors you will see a + and - sign appear under the palette name in the draw panel. Tap the + icon to add the color to the palette or tap the - icon to remove the color from the palette.

To create a sizing frame for art, press and hold anywhere on the canvas while not drawing. A frame configuration panel will appear. Enter the width and height then tap the Create button to create a frame.

To erase pixels, tap anywhere on the canvas where you haven\'t drawn yet with the color picker open to pick the transparent color off the canvas. Then draw back over the pixels that you want to erase.
This will erase your canvas and all of it\'s contents, to proceed please type ERASE CANVAS in all caps.
Email address (we don\'t store or share this):

Importing canvas data will replace your current canvas and the canvas will be permanently erased. You may want to export your current canvas data first before proceeding. To proceed please type REPLACE CANVAS in all caps.

To move an object tap the export and share button until it turns green (2 taps). Select or drag around the object you want to move. Direction indicators will appear. Tap the direction indicators and move the object in any direction. Confirm the move with the green checkmark, or cancel with the red x.
